sa7:1.2: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada’s Park in Jeta’s Grove of Śrāvastī.
sa7:2.1: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks,
sa7:2.2: “When you delight in form, you delight in suffering.
sa7:2.3: Delighting in suffering, you can’t be liberated from suffering.
sa7:2.4: Thus, when you delight in feeling …
sa7:2.8: Delighting in suffering, you can’t be liberated from suffering.
sa7:3.1: “Monks, when you don’t delight in form, you don’t delight in suffering.
sa7:3.2: Not delighting in suffering, you can be liberated from suffering.
sa7:3.3: Thus, when you don’t delight in feeling …
sa7:3.6: consciousness, you don’t delight in suffering.
sa7:3.7: Not delighting in suffering, you can be liberated from suffering.”
sa7:4.1: The monks who heard what the Buddha taught then rejoiced and approved.
